subject: Real Estate
title: Blockchain and Digital Deeds
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Blockchain and Digital Deeds.

hook.text: In many countries, land registries are paper-based, corrupt, or simply missing. Fraud is rampant.

buildup.text: Blockchain promised a solution: an immutable digital ledger that records every transfer permanently.

discovery.text: Georgia (the country) became a pioneer, putting 1.5 million land titles on a blockchain in 2017.

twist.text: But blockchain can't fix a bad record. If the initial entry is fraudulent, immutability locks in the lie.

climax.text: The technology works best where trust is lowest â€” exactly where adoption is hardest to achieve.

punchline.text: Digital deeds are only as honest as the first entry.
